speaker: SCULLY ON MACHINE
line: Mulder, it's me. I just had something incredibly strange happen. This piece of metal that they took out of Duane Barry, it has some kind of a code on it. I ran it through a scanner and some kind of a serial number came up. What the hell is this thing, Mulder? It's almost as if... it's almost as if somebody was using it to catalogue him. Mulder! I need your help!

speaker: DUANE BARRY ON MACHINE
line: Shut up!

speaker: SCULLY ON MACHINE
line: Mulder!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Come on, lady...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need your help! Mulder!

speaker: POLICEMAN
line: I'm sorry, ma'am, but you can't disturb a crime scene.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: But this is my daughter's apartment. Let me go, I have to get through. I have to get in!

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Scully? She's not in there.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Where is she? Where is she?

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: I knew it would happen this way. I had this dream about Dana being taken away. I, uh... I was going to call her but I was afraid I was going to scare her. She would have laughed at me anyway. She doesn't believe in that kind of thing, you know.

speaker: SKINNER
line: According to the reports I reviewed, Agent Scully research states that Duane Barry's propensity for violent, deviant behavior is due to brain damage from a bullet wound in the head. Is this the operational opinion?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is there another?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: He's convinced he's going to be abducted by aliens. That by taking someone to the abduction site, he won't be abducted himself.

speaker: SKINNER
line: That he's following orders from alien voices in his head.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yes.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, that's an interesting spin on the Nuremburg defense. Which explanation do you subscribe to, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's a question of how he could've gotten to her in the first place.

speaker: MAN
line: And you think these alien voices told her?

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Scully was carrying a small piece of metal that was removed from Duane Barry's abdomen, an implant he described as a tracking device.

speaker: MAN
line: Agent Scully thought that you had made a major miscalculation in Duane Barry's psychosis. Is that true?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, but that still doesn't explain how he could have found her.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where would he be taking her?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. He talked about a mountain but he wasn't specific about the location.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, however he got to her and whatever his motives, he took Agent Scully's car and weapon. I think we all understand the seriousness of this matter and should proceed ahead quickly with all possible resources. I need you to turn over your files to H.R.T...

speaker: MULDER
line: I'd like to brief them myself...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Go home, Agent Mulder, you've been up all night. Get some sleep.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir, I know Duane Barry. I've been in his head, I know how he thinks...

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're too close to this case. If we can use you, we will.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir...

speaker: SKINNER
line: That's an order, Agent Mulder. Make sure he gets home safely.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Come on.

speaker: PATROLMAN
line: Sir? Can you turn off your radio?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I would, officer, but I got to keep going.

speaker: APB WIRE CONDUCTOR
line: An F.B.I. APB has been issued for a suspect in the abduction of an F.B.I. agent...

speaker: PATROLMAN
line: Sir, I asked if you mind turning that off.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Okay. But could you just give me the ticket now so I can go? I got to be someplace.

speaker: PATROLMAN
line: Where?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I'm not sure but... they'll tell me when I get there.

speaker: PATROLMAN
line: Sir... put your hands on the steering wheel where I can see them.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: You don't understand. They're waiting for me, I, I can't be late.

speaker: PATROLMAN
line: Put your hands up and exit the vehicle.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: No, I got to keep moving. Please? For your own sake? Don't stop Duane Barry.

speaker: PATROLMAN
line: Sir, put your hands up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Right there.

speaker: VIDEO TECHNICIAN
line: Okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: Back it up a few frames. Can you magnify this area?

speaker: VIDEO TECHNICIAN
line: My God...

speaker: MULDER
line: She's still alive. Print this up.

speaker: DUANE BARRY ON RECORDING
line: I just want to go back to the place.

speaker: MULDER ON RECORDING
line: What place?

speaker: DUANE BARRY ON RECORDING
line: Where it first started. Where they first came and got me.

speaker: MULDER ON RECORDING
line: Where is that?

speaker: DUANE BARRY ON RECORDING
line: A mountain. We went, uh, up... and up. Ascending... ascending to the stars. Ascending... ascending to the stars.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Coffee?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Thanks.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yeah. How'd you sleep?

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't.

speaker: DUANE BARRY ON RECORDING
line: You're not taking Duane Barry again. A mountain. We went, uh, up... and up. Ascending... ascending to the stars. Ascending to the stars.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where was that patrolman killed again?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Rixeyville, Virginia. Route 229.

speaker: MULDER
line: Doesn't Route 229 lead to the Blue Ridge Parkway?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I don't know. What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Ascend to the stars. Skyland Mountain.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You know where he's going?

speaker: MULDER
line: Get your car and meet me downstairs.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Where are we going?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just get your car.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What about Skinner?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll deal with Skinner.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: He thinks Scully's been taken up to Skyland Mountain. I'll hold him off until they locate her. Wait, here he comes. I'll be in touch.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, let's go.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Hey! You're dozing off. Maybe I should drive.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm fine.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Well, you haven't slept yet. I have.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I said I'm fine.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You know, Chernobyl, Exxon Valdez, Three Mile Island... they were all linked to sleep deprivation. The U.S. Department of Transportation estimates that over 190,000 fatal car crashes every year are linked to sleepiness.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did they estimate how many people are put to sleep listening to their statistics?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I'm just trying to keep you awake.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look, I know you think we should have told Skinner but if he sends in the whole cavalry, Duane Barry might go over the edge.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You're right.

speaker: MULDER
line: If we find him first, we'll notify the Bureau. All right?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yeah. You really think he tracked her down with that implant?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that's the easiest explanation. It's also the most implausible.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Is there another possibility?

speaker: MULDER
line: Somebody could have given him her address. I don't know who.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You seen this guy?

speaker: TRAM OPERATOR
line: Yeah, he was here.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: He's wanted for kidnapping a federal agent. Did you let him go up in the tram?

speaker: TRAM OPERATOR
line: No way, it's shut down for the summer. I told him to take the back road up.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: How long ago?

speaker: TRAM OPERATOR
line: About forty-five minutes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did he have a woman with him?

speaker: TRAM OPERATOR
line: No.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: How long does it take to drive to the top?

speaker: TRAM OPERATOR
line: Little over an hour.

speaker: MULDER
line: You gotta get me up there.

speaker: TRAM OPERATOR
line: No, no way. We just got done refitting the cable. It hasn't been tested with passengers yet. You'll have to drive.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't have the time.

speaker: TRAM OPERATOR
line: You don't have a choice.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, you don't have a choice.

speaker: TRAM OPERATOR
line: Okay, I can't stop you from going up there but if there's a problem with the cable, I'm shutting this down. I'm not going to be responsible for your death.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Stay here and whatever happens, don't let him stop the tram.

speaker: TRAM OPERATOR
line: Okay, you hit your "run" and "up" button on the panel. Speed indicator controls your ascent. Now when you want to slow down... Don't crank it faster than fifteen! What the hell's he doing? I told him not to go that fast. Base to car one, pick up. Do you hear that sound? At this speed, the cable can't hold....a sec. Do you hear me? Slow...

speaker: MULDER
line: Go ahead.

speaker: TRAM OPERATOR
line: Slow it down.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're breaking up.

speaker: TRAM OPERATOR
line: Slow down or the cables'll jump when you hit that tower! Slow it down for the next tower.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: How close is he?

speaker: TRAM OPERATOR
line: Should be up top in a minute. There he is.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you doing? Turn it back on. Krycek, what's happening down there? Krycek, do you read me? Tell the operator to restart the tram. Hello?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I've got him stalled up there. I'll hold until you advise.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there an emergency system on-board? Can you read me down there? Can anyone read me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Federal agent!

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Yes!

speaker: MULDER
line: Freeze!

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Yes, yes, yes!

speaker: MULDER
line: I said freeze! Where is she?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I'm free, you son of a bitches! You can't touch Duane Barry anymore!

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't move. Don't move!

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I'm not going anywhere!

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is she? Where'd you leave her?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: They took her.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Them! I told you they would take somebody else. They did! No, no! No! No, no, no! No! No! No! No! Nooo! Noooo!

speaker: APB WIRE CONTROLLER
line: Choppers found them on the mountain. Send out five teams to search for that federal agent.

speaker: MEDIC #2
line: Water.

speaker: MEDIC #1
line: We'll wait outside.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now what happened after you took her out of the trunk?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: We walked a-little ways up to the top of the mountain. Right where you found me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then where'd you take her?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I didn't. They did. That was the deal. Her instead of me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you kill her?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: No. I swear.

speaker: MULDER
line: How'd you get this?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: From the ship.

speaker: MULDER
line: What ship?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: You saw it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I saw a helicopter.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: They were here. I'm not lying to you! There they are. Ask them. They know what happened!

speaker: MULDER
line: Sit down, Duane.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: No! You've got to stop them! Hurry, hurry! They were just out there! They were right outside!

speaker: MULDER
line: Duane, settle down!

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: They'll tell you where she is! The military's in on it, just ask them!

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you hurt her?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you hurt her!?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: No!

speaker: MULDER
line: What is this?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I'm sorry. They had to take her. I hope they're not hurting her... too much with the tests. I'm sorry.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Hey?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What, what's the matter, what, what'd he say to you?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, he's giving me nothing. Were you out here alone?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yeah, why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Nobody goes in or out of that room.

speaker: MAN
line: Hey, Mulder?

speaker: APB WIRE CONTROLLER
line: Rescue two, we're on the Warsaw building, southwest.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you doing in there?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I heard him...

speaker: MULDER
line: Come here.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I heard him gagging in there, he couldn't breathe.

speaker: MULDER
line: No one...

speaker: MULDER
line: No one!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: He said you choked him!

speaker: MULDER
line: No one is to interrogate the suspect.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Except you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Except me. Did you ask him about Scully?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: What'd he say?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: He started whistling "Stairway to Heaven." Keep an eye on him.

speaker: GUARD
line: Okay.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You got Duane Barry?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder, you disobeyed my direct order.

speaker: GUARD
line: Call the paramedics!

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened?

speaker: GUARD
line: He was gagging...

speaker: MULDER
line: Duane? Duane? Duane!

speaker: PARAMEDIC #1
line: Coming through!

speaker: PARAMEDIC #2
line: Respiration?

speaker: PARAMEDIC #1
line: Hmm, nothing. CPR...

speaker: PARAMEDIC #2
line: Ready? One, two, three, four, five... One, two, three...

speaker: FBI ACADEMY MORGUE; QUANTICO, VIRGINIA; 6
line: 07 AM "Medical Examiner Mulder is standing over it. A female doctor walks in.)

speaker: PATHOLOGIST
line: Excuse me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm Agent Mulder. I'd like a copy of this man's autopsy report.

speaker: PATHOLOGIST
line: I'm sorry, it's still incomplete.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you the pathologist?

speaker: PATHOLOGIST
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can I ask what your preliminary findings are?

speaker: PATHOLOGIST
line: Umm... "Second-degree burns to the face, contusions about the neck, bruised larynx..." If I had to list cause of death at this point, I'd have to say asphyxiation. Were you expecting something else?

speaker: MULDER
line: You haven't run a toxicological yet?

speaker: PATHOLOGIST
line: They should be finished shortly.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'd be interested to see what you find. When will they be on file?

speaker: PATHOLOGIST
line: Later this morning.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'd like a copy as soon as possible, please.

speaker: PATHOLOGIST
line: Oh, I'm sorry, you'll have to go through regular military channels.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean, "military?" You're not F.B.I.?

speaker: PATHOLOGIST
line: Quantico's under military jurisdiction. There wasn't an F.B.I. pathologist available this morning.

speaker: DOWNTOWN WASHINGTON, D.C.; 6
line: 16 AM

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Skinner's expecting my report on the Duane Barry incident. What do I tell him?

speaker: CSM
line: The truth.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What do you mean?

speaker: CSM
line: Confirm Mulder's version of events. You've earned his trust, the object now is to preserve it.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: For how much longer?

speaker: CSM
line: Until your assignment is complete.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: If Mulder is such a threat, why not eliminate him?

speaker: CSM
line: That's not policy.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: It's not? After what you had me do?

speaker: CSM
line: Kill Mulder and you risk turning one man's religion into a crusade.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What about Scully?

speaker: CSM
line: We've taken care of that.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: How?

speaker: CSM
line: We tell you only what you need to know.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I think I have a right to know.

speaker: CSM
line: You have no rights, only orders to be carried out. If you have a problem with that, we'll make other arrangements.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Victim appears to have expired from prolonged hypoxemia, secondary to asphyxiation. Several possible etiologies and most likely strangulation due to the presence of contusions and a bruised larynx. Do you want to speak to this, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't kill him, if that's what you're suggesting.

speaker: SKINNER
line: But you attacked him?

speaker: MULDER
line: I was interrogating him about Agent Scully. He wasn't cooperating so I pushed him.

speaker: MAN
line: And you lost control.

speaker: MULDER
line: Momentarily. But then I left the room. He was very much alive, I spoke to him. Agent Krycek spoke to him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Krycek says he entered the room because the suspect was gagging.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is Agent Krycek asserting that I killed him too?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No. He corroborates your story. But the fact is, we've got a dead suspect, Agent Mulder and no other plausible cause of death. O.P.C. wants the both of you to take a lie detector test. You're to report there immediately.

speaker: MULDER
line: There is another plausible cause of death.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Which is?

speaker: MULDER
line: Poisoning by injection or ingestion.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Poisoning?

speaker: MULDER
line: You won't find that on the navy pathologist's report.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What are you saying, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: That the autopsy is incomplete. That the military covered up the toxicological findings.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And why would they do that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because they know where Scully is.

speaker: MAN
line: Why are you so paranoid, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, I don't know. Maybe it's because I find it hard to trust anybody.

speaker: MULDER
line: Alex? Alex, can I borrow your car keys?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Why, where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's someone I've got to see.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yeah, but we're scheduled at O.P.C...

speaker: MULDER
line: I know, just give me the car keys please. Thanks.

speaker: X
line: You've wasted a trip, Mister Mulder. There's nothing the Senator can do for you now.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: X
line: Not without committing political suicide.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why? Do they have something on him?

speaker: X
line: They have something on everyone, Mister Mulder. The question is when they'll use it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I need his help.

speaker: X
line: No one can help you now. Your channels of appeal and recourse are closed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Your predecessor could have helped me. Oh... you know, don't you? You know what's happened to her.

speaker: X
line: This reaches beyond any of us, Mister Mulder. Even my predecessor.

speaker: MULDER
line: I want an answer!

speaker: X
line: Why kill Duane Barry if there was nothing to hide?

speaker: MULDER
line: You mean the government?

speaker: X
line: There are no answers for you, Mister Mulder. They only have one policy... Deny everything.

speaker: SKINNER
line: This is a serious allegation, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: So long as it's true.

speaker: SKINNER
line: "Agent Krycek was hired or suborned by an outside agency to impede a federal investigation and may be responsible for the death of a suspect in a capitol murder case."?

speaker: MULDER
line: It goes on.

speaker: SKINNER
line: "And the possible murder of the tram operator at Skyland Mountain." There's a lot of blood on this document, Agent Mulder. Are you standing behind this, going on the record?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then you damn well better have the facts to back it up. I need to see Agent Krycek immediately. I can't protect you, Agent Mulder. Past a point, this will become a larger bureau matter. All right, what do you got?

speaker: MULDER
line: I found this in Agent Krycek's car. He doesn't smoke. Agent Krycek was the last person with Duane Barry before he died. He was also the last person to see the tram operator before he disappeared. When I got to the top of Skyline Mountain, I saw an unmarked helicopter working the area. I believe that Agent Krycek gave away the whereabouts of Duane Barry and Agent Scully to whoever he's working with.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And who is that?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, the military? Some covert organization within the government? Whoever it is that man who smokes those cigarettes works for.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because Agent Scully got too close to whatever it is they're trying to deny. Because she had hard and damning evidence, that metallic implant in her possession. Or because her termination would prevent further involvement with me and my work.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Do you think Agent Scully's dead?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. How far do you think they'd go? What do you know about Agent Krycek?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I didn't give him the assignment, I only... Yes. Thank you. Agent Krycek didn't show up for work this morning. His home number has been disconnected.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's it? He's gone, he just disappears into the woodwork?

speaker: SKINNER
line: So it would appear.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who are these people who can just murder with impunity and we can't do anything about it?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Let it go, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Like hell.

speaker: SKINNER
line: There's nothing you can do.

speaker: MULDER
line: What can you do about it?

speaker: SKINNER
line: There's only one thing I can do, Agent Mulder. As of right now, I'm reopening the X-Files. That's what they fear the most.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder? Thank you for calling me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry I don't have better news.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Do you know something? Is Dana okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: We don't know anything more about her.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: I know you're doing all you can. I had that dream again last night. About Dana being taken away? I can't tell you how it scares me.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's probably scarier when you stop having the dream. Don't you think? I found this. It's something I... I never considered about her. If she was... if she was such a skeptic, why did she wear that?

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: I gave it to her on her fifteenth birthday.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't you want to keep it?

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: When you find her, you give it to her.
